intro: Ipomoea linosepala subsp. alpina, commonly known as the alpine morning glory, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves with a waxy texture. The flowers are typically pale blue or violet, with five petals and a distinctive spurred shape. This subspecies thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its botanical features make it a unique and ornamental addition to specialized gardens.
